    • Method Detail

      • readCSVFile

        public void readCSVFile(String csvFilePath,
                        int userColumnIndex,
                        int itemColumnIndex)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Reads user-item information from an CSV file, and constructs a mapping between read names and IDs. Name: The original information (name, id, etc.) of users or items from the CSV file ID: The transformed (remapped) integers in this class
        Parameters:
        csvFilePath - The path of the assigned CSV file.
        userColumnIndex - Assigns which column index represents users.
        itemColumnIndex - Assigns which column index represents items.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the CSV file cannot be opened.

      • readDatabase

        public void readDatabase(String databaseURL,
                         String databaseName,
                         String account,
                         String password,
                         String tableName,
                         String userField,
                         String itemField)
        Reads user-item information from a PostgreSQL database, and constructs a mapping between read names and IDs
        Parameters:
        databaseURL - The URL (consisting of the port number) of the assigned PostgreSQL database like "54.64.73.96:5432".
        databaseName - The name of the assigned database like "oneclickshoppingwall".
        account - An account to log in the database.
        password - The password of the account.
        tableName - The name of a table in the assigned database like "product_order".
        userField - The field representing users like "aid".
        itemField - The field representing items like "pid".

      • writeOutputFile

        public void writeOutputFile(String outputFilePath)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Write current data to outputFilePath (in libFM format).
        Parameters:
        outputFilePath - The output file path.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the outputFilePath cannot be opened.

      • getLibfmFormatLines

        public List<String> getLibfmFormatLines()
        Dump current data into lines of Strings in libFM format.
        Returns:
        A list of Strings in libFM format.

      • convertToLibfmFormat

        public String convertToLibfmFormat(String user,
                                   String item)
        Convert a user-item pair into a String in libFM format. If the user-item pair has not been seen, the rating will be -1.
        Parameters:
        user - The user name.
        item - The item name.
        Returns:
        The converted line.

      • mapUserNameToID

        public int mapUserNameToID(String name)
        Convert a user name to the integer index used in this system.
        Parameters:
        name - User name in the original CSV file or database.
        Returns:
        the converted integer index used in this system.

      • mapItemNameToID

        public int mapItemNameToID(String name)
        Convert an item name to the integer index used in this system.
        Parameters:
        name - Item name in the original CSV file or database.
        Returns:
        the converted integer index used in this system.

      • mapUserIDToName

        public String mapUserIDToName(int ID)
        Convert an integer index back into the original user name.
        Parameters:
        ID - the converted integer index used in this system.
        Returns:
        User name in the original CSV file or database.

      • mapItemIDToName

        public String mapItemIDToName(int ID)
        Convert an integer index back into the original item name.
        Parameters:
        ID - the converted integer index used in this system.
        Returns:
        Item name in the original CSV file or database.

      • getUserSet

        public Set<String> getUserSet()
        Get the Set of all users.
        Returns:
        The set of users (the original names in the database).

      • getItemSet

        public Set<String> getItemSet()
        Get the Set of all items.
        Returns:
        The set of items (the original names in the database).

      • getRating

        public Integer getRating(String user,
                         String item)
        Get the rating for a user-item pair. Returns null if we have not observed this user-item pair.
        Parameters:
        user - The user name.
        item - The item name.
        Returns:
        the rating if this user-item pair has been observed, otherwise null.
